alert.note: Alert for Moses Lake Area; Waterville Plateau (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 8:25AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of central Douglas, western Adams, southwestern Lincoln and Grant Counties through 900 AM PDT... At 824 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers near Ephrata, or 14 miles north of Moses Lake, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Frequent gusts of 30 to 40 mph have been reported in Grant and Douglas counties with these showers. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Moses Lake, Ephrata, Othello, Warden, Moses Lake North, Lakeview, Banks Lake South, Cascade Valley, Royal City, Soap Lake, Odessa, Wilbur, Coulee City, Almira, Wilson Creek, Hartline, Hatton, Krupp, Batum, and Irby. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 160 and 207. U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 160 and 223. U.S. Highway 395 in Washington between mile markers 62 and 71. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
